thread.title: Dog abandoned on Valentine's Day in Leeds looking for loving family
thread.title_full: Dog abandoned on Valentine's Day in Leeds looking for loving family | Calendar - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Dog abandoned on Valentine's Day in Leeds looking for loving family
text:
Credit: Dogs Trust Rescuers are trying to find a new home for a dog found tied to a park gate in Leeds on Valentine’s Day with a note around her neck.
The one-year-old cross-breed, who was found abandoned in East End Park with a note saying ‘I am Lara’ was taken to Dogs Trust Leeds last week.
Whilst so many dogs were enjoying being spoilt by their devoted owners, poor Lara was scared and alone.
Sometimes owners can no longer keep their dog for unavoidable reasons, and it’s really sad for them and the dog, but we would urge anyone who can no longer look after their dog to never abandon them in this way. It puts them at risk and through unnecessary stress.
Luckily Lara was picked up by the dog warden and since then the team have definitely given her all the love she had missed out on on Valentine’s Day.
– Amanda Sands, Centre manager To find out more about dogs that need rehoming visit the Dogs Trust website .
Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017 Animals Leeds
